summary: A character reference letter written to Judge Alison J. Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail request. The author, who has known Maxwell since her youth, attests to her good character, work ethic, and generosity, expresses shock at her arrest, asserts her innocence, and argues she would not flee if granted bail.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the character reference letter. The author describes her as a lovely, energetic, capable, warm, loving, and generous person who is innocent of the charges and would not flee if granted bail.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over Ghislaine Maxwell's case in the Southern District of New York, to whom the character reference letter is addressed.

connections.description: The author has known Ghislaine Maxwell since her youth, remained close after she moved to America, and has sent their daughter to spend time with her.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell on criminal charges, which the letter's author expresses utter shock about.

events.title: Scheduled Court Date
events.description: The author references Ghislaine Maxwell's determination to fight the charges in court in July 2021.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a character reference letter submitted to the court in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's 2020 bail request.
The author, who has known Maxwell since her youth, strongly asserts her innocence and good character, stating she has never witnessed her be violent or sexually inappropriate.
The author expresses confidence that Maxwell would not flee if granted bail and would fight the charges in court.
The letter references that the author's daughter (referred to as 'MUM') spent time with Maxwell after university, indicating Maxwell hosted young people.
The document is part of the public record in Maxwell's criminal case in the Southern District of New York.
